Key Match Events: Nikola Jovic made the tying layup and go-ahead foul shot with 7.8 seconds left to send the Miami Heat past the Minnesota Timberwolves 95-94.
Mike Conley’s 3-point attempt at the buzzer was short, ending the Timberwolves' three-game winning streak.
Jaden McDaniels gave the Timberwolves the lead with a putback of Conley’s miss with nine seconds left.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tyler Herro had 26 points for the Heat, who played without star Jimmy Butler.
Anthony Edwards scored 22 points on 8-for-24 shooting for the Timberwolves.
The Heat overcame 23 turnovers with 14 steals and nine blocks, all season highs.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. returned from a three-game absence due to illness.
The Timberwolves had 20 turnovers and a season-best 16 offensive rebounds, six by Rudy Gobert.
Naz Reid hit a 3-pointer late in the third quarter to put the Timberwolves up 64-63, their first lead since 10-9.
Tyler Herro set a career best with his 39th consecutive game, including the playoffs, with double-digit points.
